Message.Title: $20? Thats Crazy
Message.Msg: I see all these pundits on tv and posters speaking how BAC, COULD goto 15, or 18, or 20, BECAUSE OF THE BUYBACK. Let us all take a trip back 2 years ago, 2011, crisis has passed, BAC trades at 20.00 a share before lawsuits begin every quarter nearly. I propose a buyback could bring us well above the 20.00 we traded.

True, true, and true. BAC WAS at $54 pre-crisis. Now they have Merryll Lynch adding $10 where before it was not even part of the company. Add to it, housing is Hot in some areas again. Yet this is selling at 60% of book value? Wait when it reports earnings we fly to $15.

Why people watch and worry about this stock daily I just don't understand. This is a long term investment and its obvious where we are headed in the next 3 to 5 years. Returning to $50 is a reach but to $30 is a given.

I would not rule out the possibility of SIFI being increased to be in line with the other majors. I'm not totally convinced the capital raises are over with but BAC is improving its cost structure with the buyback of preferred. They can add capital by retaining what used to be paid to those holders.

I think the share float was already over six billion just before CW. I have more modest expectations on the buybacks, after all there were two of them plus Warren Buffet's shares and some additional restricted shares for officers.

Message.Title: I found another way to stop drooling on my keyboard !
Message.Msg: I glued my keyboard to the ceiling of the trailer court's port-o-john.

That's because everyone is looking at pre-recession profits and expecting all the banks to recover to that point (Mr. Bove included). But don't forget, those profits were based on a huge housing bubble, the games they played with derrivitives, and at least 4b shares less in the pool. BAC will not see that level of profit until they reduce the share level to a reasonable number.
I have to watch this stock on a daily basis as it goes up I buy more on margin.

Agree with blacktieeddie, too much has changed to make these comparisons. They cannot pay 60% of their earnings out in dividends at 64Â¢ a share, the Fed will not allow it. Net interest income is flat, Durbin limits the interchange banking revenue. BAC sold off profitable businesses in Britain and South America to simplify the company and satisfy regulators that their risk footprint was smaller. It is still going to take another couple of years to wind down the failing portfolio from Countrywide. It's a healing company and a good investment, but shares won't be leaping to pre-crisis trading levels.

They are not saying that because of the buyback. The buyback will only raise the share price .20-.30 per share. The buy back is only important because is shows real progress in the company. Your post is frankly ludicrous at worst and/or just not aware of how this works at best. It is also extremely missleading.

You posts are not very smart. There is a world of difference in the banking industry between pre-crises and today. Your pre-crisis price was based on a housing bubble and ludicrous profits that were made on flimsy investment instruments which mostly went bad and, lo and behold, the financial system almost collapsed because of them. With a 10b+ share pool it is not returning to the level you quote. Not until the share pool is reduced to a decent level. It's simple mathematics. Why don't you discuss currently fundamentals and market conditions rather than what was? The world has changed. Your way of thinking has not.

Topic.Title: Actually bought BAC and putting it away for the long term...can't believe I just said that

Message.Msg: BAC got almost nothing of lasting value from the CW purchase. CW was national, BAC has wound down operations only to the states where they have banking centers or Merrill offices. Most of the CW mortgage people left, as the market melted down and were unable to continue peddling the zero-down zero-doc loans they used to. Even the vaunted servicing and origination platforms were painful transitions and BAC is talking to new vendors for technology again. Countrywide was an expensive, painful lesson from start to finish of what a half-researched impulsive deal by the CEO can lead to.

Message.Title: Zagg is also buying back shares, Whitney calling zagg the most shorted stock in years but ready to have one if the biggest short squeezes in market history .

He doesn't even understand how the share float affects the price. Sorry, Gam, not meaning to attack you, but I do see your opinions as just that and rather valueless...

Message.Title: This week, Palm sunday
Message.Msg: This week, yes Palm Sunday, had its mostly usual sponsorsâno gold or food hoarders, thank you, and of course the natural gas pressure group and car manufacturer. It also had GOPâs Karl Rove, happy that the Senate passed a budget, because it might permit the âgive and takeâ of budget drafting that scholars like to cite. Donna Brazile seemed to echo the thought. Talking about gun legislation, Jim Messina, Democrat campaign leader, 2012, thinks 8-1 margin in favor of âbackground checksâ for gun buying is good news. Rove, though, feels some national registry of gun owners might be in the wingsâterrible, terrible, even the thought!!! Ms Brazile admitted âthere are not the votesâ in the Senate for an assault gun ban. Talk of the GOP review/autopsy, etc. GOP admits the âimageââit is not âinclusiveâ and has many old men (white) for members. Rove trumpeted that GOP has 30 governors!!!, mentioned a few of the reactionary (ok, âconservativeâ) ones, also Senators Rubio and Cruz as bright lights for the yes âconservativeâ GOP. Argue, he said, that GOP is the party of âeconomic prosperityâ and good things will occur. Peggy Noonan, eloquent always, and a WSJ writer, spoke of GOP internal battleââdebt reductionâ vs âeconomic growthâ. Brazile retort: GOP is against the majority of American people. Rand Paul, Senator, was quoted--::We cannot deport 12 million, oh, let the borders be made secure(r). Brief mention of Roe v WadeâMs Noonan says, âlet states decide itââ¦ditto the âmarriage equality matterâ. Justice ginsburg referenced, she said Roe v Wade was too sweeping. Obama in Israel, etcâ¦showed Iran (nuclear weapon) of greater concern than Israel-Palestine issue, at least right now. Brief mention of resigned NJ governor McGreevey, touching upon redemption (his gayness, his distress passing prisons with many in them due to drug issues). He is working with daughter (not so identified) of Nancy Pelosi re his concerns. One soldier, age 37, from Ohio, made the ultimate

Message.Title: Cyprus solution
Message.Msg: Cyprus has 13 1/2 tons of gold and has the population size of Philadelphia, slip the euro control, tell big bank bond holders and bank stockholders "sorry, you lose out" because of bad bets on Greek Bonds, Establish a 10x fractional gold based Dinar or shilling/pound whatever...gold silver money will maintain strength and found a strong non inflating currency that the world will flock to....simply reissue your gold/silver money in proportion to citizens lost deposits. Euro zone needs more little Iceland type tough regiemes that tell the big bankers "Hell no, we won't pay for your bad bets, you damnable risk-junkie-losers" OFF OUR BACKS, GO TO JAIL! The other alternative is the US FED bailing them, what the hell is 10 bil....we do 85 bil each month of money printing to support the phoney stock market recovery...European domino collapse would cost us trillions and takes years for the world to recover from....make FED the world "bad bank" (it is already)
An absolutely wonderfully succinct and accurate synopsis! Well done!
US cannot be everyone's daddy. now, if cyprus wants to become our 51st state, then we can talk.-jmho-bucko

Topic.Title: I love to see the right-wing piggy fools squeal and scream. Your pain is my gain. LMAO!

Message.Msg: F*** Off, loser fool.

California takes back nearly everything it gives in the form of welfare payments. In 2 more years, projected CA will take far more than it contributes. So past performance is no guarantee of future results. Unless liberals are ruining the show. Then you can count on #$%$-poor performance and bankruptcy while they argue about the "important" issues like gay marriage and anti-bullying and how Bush caused 9/11. But know this, they have finally lived long enough in their "utopian" cesspool to become a burden to the rest of us.
They report earnings April 17th then it will explode higher or lower. Remember no big lawsuit settlements this quarter thus we should get a feel for the real earnings power or lack thereof.

Every quarter I see people on here prognosticate that "this time" the stock will rocket after earnings. It doesn't happen because the street and ratings agencies have a pretty good idea where a major bank's earnings will land. The number misses or exceeds expectations by a few pennies, and that gets spun on MSNBC etc. If you're in this stock you should be working the long term trend, which has been up since Dec of 2011.

Message.Title: THANKS BERNANKE AND THE BANKERS, FOR IMPOVERISHING OUR ELDERLY CITIZENS
Message.Msg: For years people were told to make sure they took part of their pay and put away some each week in the Bank in order to assure they would have enough for retirement. After saving for years, the pig Banksters began to systemically abscond with their money by stealing it with fat bonuses, and gambling it away in non bank endeavors. After thieving for years, not one of them has seen the inside of a prison. The phrase "I neither admit or deny the charges", became their way of escape. They were then fined a sliver of their stealings.. Because of their crimes, the economy sank into oblivion, and interest rates were brought down for saving almost to O. Now, not only are their savings unable to cover their everyday expenses, but prices keep rising, slowly putting them into poverty. One day, the honest citizens will unite, and I'm sure a second revolution will again happen, just as it had against the British when they attempted to do the same thing to their citizens, creating an exodus to America in order to free themselves from the yolk of financial tyranny.
